newsitem.title: CHINA: Allied Signal to up investment in China.
newsitem.headline: Allied Signal to up investment in China.

text.p: Allied Signal Inc of the United States plans to increase its investment in China by $50 million to $200 million in five years, the Xinhua news agency said on Thursday.

Allied Signal also plans to open a company in Shanghai, Xinhua quoted Allied Signal Aerospace vice-president Bob Choulet as saying. Choulet is in the southern Chinese city of Zhuhai to attend an international aviation and aerospace exhibition.
Allied Signal and Shanghai Aviation Electronics Co signed an agreement on Thursday to set up a $4 million joint venture in China to make electronic parts for aircraft, Xinhua said.
Allied Signal also agreed to jointly develop aircraft engine systems and auxiliary parts with Aviation Industries of China, Xinhua said.
China Northwest Airlines had just purchased aircraft power equipment worth $21 million from Allied Signal, Xinhua said.
